The Node.js code appears to be setting up module exports for use in other parts of an application. It imports a module (`./index`) and assigns its `default` export as the module's primary export. Additionally, it imports a specific utility function, `defaultGetLocalIdent`, from another module (`./utils`) and assigns it as a named export. This setup allows the module to expose a default behavior along with a specific utility function that can be utilized in other parts of the application.

Here's a possible rewrite of the code:

```javascript
"use strict";

const { default: defaultExport } = require("./index");
const { defaultGetLocalIdent } = require("./utils");

module.exports = defaultExport;
module.exports.defaultGetLocalIdent = defaultGetLocalIdent;
```
